ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned how to conjugate past present future. Learned how to converse and listen to czech movies and media
I learned CZech verb conjugations, how to understand passages and answer questions about them, how to use adjectives and adverbs correctly, colors, days of the week, months, etc
I really felt like I learned a lot about not only the language but also the culture in the Czech Republic.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength was it was so fun and easy to engage and participate

Strengths: KVK is so accessible to her students and helpful 

Weaknesses: CZech is a hard language to learn in general
I really felt like going over our homework assignments in class really helped, and also reading texts out loud in class was super helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Always loved coming to class. Kvk best professor ive had always happy and listens to her students
Yes! I had a great experience and learned a lot

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I feel like I learned so much in my three semesters taking the language and the feedback from my professor really helped me get better faster.
